channel.title: Highscores not displaying?
channel.description:
I've only done this hundreds of times... I just dont understand it.
I've already implemented the highscores server sided and made the sql db etc etc. Everything is connecting just fine, when the player dces it even updates the DB. but for some stupid reason its not displaying on page. Im using deathscape tut and template.
I am doing everything local though. running the server and site localy. Has anyone ever had the issue of running the server locally with a site and it not running correctly with the db?

OT I hate not having my web dev badge on display :mad:

item.title: Highscores not displaying?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

the fuck? running httrack to find the dir?

if your running a server locally. anyone who plays has the ip. if the database is hosted locally (using xampp or any mysql stack) it also uses the same ip, just a different port.

the tutorial you used is highly vulnerable to injection and it is a possibility that happened. so stop being an arrogant ass and try to help us help you?

post the highscores php code that pulls from the database?

Read full topic

item.title: Highscores not displaying?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

Did I once say that the DB is not running? How abotu you stop acting like you know what your talking about. There is nothing on this thread that is relevent to my OP. My link is posted no where. Yes I realize it wouldnt take a scientist to run httrack and find the dir but until someone does that nobody is seeing it and they dont realize it is even there. There is nothing telling them that their acc is being saved via sql. kk you can fk yourself now.

Read full topic

item.title: Highscores not displaying?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:8, topic:524461”]Nobody has access to hs atm. The only way its getting touched is if on logout someone is able to craft a packet and sends it[/quote]if the server communicates to the database upon log out, that means the database is running (obviously). stop acting like you know what you’re talking about and appreciate the help people are attempting to give you.

Read full topic

item.title: Highscores not displaying?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:

item.title: Highscores not displaying?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“4x4Chevrolet, post:5, topic:524461”]Well seeing as nobody has access to our site because the highscore data isn’t actually on the server but stored locally, only people that could of injected it would be him.[/quote]if the server has communication to the database, that means mysql is running. and generally apache runs as well. if that is running, anyone given your address can connect. sql injection is easy, and highly vulnerable is death’s tutorial.

the reason is may no display could be code errors, or it could have been injected.

Read full topic
